BXEntityDescription Class Reference
BaseTen » Descriptions

Overview

An entity description contains information about a specific table or view in a given database.

Only one entity description instance is created for a combination of a database URI, a schema and a table.

Note
This class's documented methods are thread-safe. Creating objects, however, is not.
For this class to work in non-GC applications, the corresponding database context must be retained as well.

Method Documentation

- (NSDictionary *) attributesByName

Attributes for this entity.

Primary key fields and other fields for this entity.

Returns
An NSDictionary with NSStrings as keys and BXAttributeDescriptions as objects.
See also
- isValidated
- (Class) databaseObjectClass

The class for this entity.

Returns
The default class is BXDatabaseObject.
- (NSArray *) fields

Non-primary key fields for this entity.

Returns
An array of BXAttributeDescriptions
See also
- isValidated
- (BOOL) isValidated

Entity validation.

The entity will be validated after a database connection has been made. Afterwards, fields, primaryKeyFields, attributesByName and relationshipsByName return meaningful values.

Note
To call this safely, mValidationLock should be acquired first. Our validation methods do this, though.
- (NSArray *) primaryKeyFields

Primary key fields for this entity.

The fields get determined automatically after database connection has been made.

Returns
An array of BXAttributeDescriptions
See also
- isValidated
- (NSDictionary *) relationshipsByName

Relationships for this entity.

Returns
An NSDictionary with NSStrings as keys and BXRelationshipDescriptions as objects.
- (void) setDatabaseObjectClass: (Class)  cls

Set the class for this entity.

Objects fetched using this entity will be instances of the given class, which needs to be a subclass of BXDatabaseObject.

Parameters
clsThe object class.
Note
If objects have been fetched from this entity before setting a class, those objects might be returned by subsequent fetches. It is best to set the class before connecting to the database.
